attributes.action: put pressure on credit card issuers to stop the practise of upping interest rates and adding unexpected fees to customers bills
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: President Obama has, on the 24th April 2009, called in the top industry executives of the credit card industry, in the USA, in order that he demand that they stop increasing interest rates  and adding unexpected fees to customer bills. You, the Prime Minister, should be doing the same to those running the credit card business in the UK, and help to prevent what is appearing to be a developing "lone-shark" mentality, using the credit crunch as an excuse.  Their actions cause great difficulty and pain to many in this country. How is it justifiable for companies to increase their rates from 24% to 35% when the bank base rate is under 1%? Something needs to be done and quickly.
